title: SLT settings
content:
For out-of-the-box record types, the SLT settings tab enables you to control the out-of-the-box email notifications that Service Management sends as a Service Level target approaches a breach threshold. The notifications are described in Notifications.

For custom record types you have created in Studio, the SLT settings tab enables you to control the SLT calculation and configure the key fields that are involved in SLT.

To access the SLT settings tab:

  1. From the main menu, select Administration > Configuration > Studio.
  2. From the drop-down at the top of the page, select Incident, Request, or a custom record type created in Studio.
  3. Click the SLT settings tab.
  • After saving the changes made to an SLT setting, you need to click the Apply button to apply the changes. 
  • You can't apply the changes to an SLT setting if the former setting is applied for the records at present. In this case, an error message is displayed when you click the Apply button.

Configure SLT settings for requests and incidents

For the Request and Incident record types, configure the settings as follows. 

Enable and disable automatic notifications for incidents or requests

For each target type, select On to enable the automatic notifications, or select Off to disable them, and then click Save. The out-of-the-box notifications for the selected records are enabled or disabled according to your selection for all records of the selected record type. 

For the Request record type, the tab displays the following.

Section Targets

Support (support requests and case requests)

  • Initial review

  • Resolution

  • Time in Group

Service (service requests)

  • Fulfillment

  • Time in Group

HR (HR support requests)

  • Initial review

  • Resolution

  • Fulfillment

  • Time in Group

For the Incident record type, the tab displays the following.

Section Targets

Support

  • Initial review

  • Resolution

  • Time in Group

You can manually add a notification for a specific target at a specific breach level by defining a business rule. This ensures that a notification is sent even when the automatic notifications are set to Off. For more information, see How to add Service Level Target event business rules.

Configure fields for SLT calculation

In the Field configuration section, configure the default fields to use for calculating the target dates for Service Level Target definitions. 

Field Description
Customer Defines a Person field in the record type. The out-of-the-box value is Requested for for Request and Reported by for Incident.
Assignment group

Defines an assignment group field of the record type. There're three options (the out-of-the-box option is Assignment group for both Request and Incident):

  • Assignment group: use the field according to the value of the Current assignment field:
    • If the value is Service Desk: use the Service desk group field
    • If the value is Expert Group: use the Expert group field
  • Expert group: use the Expert group field
  • Service desk group: use the Service desk group field

Note: If the Assignment group is not specified for an OLA, the SLT calculation can still be started. However, this serves no purpose from a business perspective. To avoid this from happening, you can add a condition to the start rule. For example, for the Change record type, the default Assignment group field is OwnedByGroup, so you can add this condition: entity.OwnedByGroup!=null.  

The field configuration here works for each Service Level Target target set. When you create a Service Level Target set record, you specify a default setting for time zone or work schedule. For details, see Create a Service Level Target set record.


For each Service Level Target set record, the system automatically creates target definitions with these default values. You can edit an individual target definition record by clicking Details, to change the time zone and work schedule from the default values. For more information, see Edit a Service Level Target definition record.

Additionally, in the Availability section of each Person or Group record, you can specify the work schedule and time zone for the person or group. For more information, see How to create or delete a contact record and Groups.

This way, the system can calculate the target date in the context of each ticket when a relevant Service Level Target definition has a work schedule or time zone defined as Customer or Assignment group.  

  • If the system can't retrieve a work schedule or time zone for a service level target, the system uses the 24 x 7 work schedule or the UTC time zone, respectively. This is true no matter which option you select for the work schedule or time zone fields: Customer, Assignment group, or Specific value. 
  • If you change the field configuration in Studio, the changes take effect on relevant SLT calculations immediately.
  • For Request or Incident, if you change the field configuration, you need to click Apply to apply the new configuration to Request or Incident records. 

Enable the SLT settings for custom record types created in Studio

Before configuring the SLT settings for the record types created in Studio, you need to:

  1. Add three fields referenced to Actual Service, Group, Person, and Priority.

    Logical type Reference to
    ENTITY_LINK Actual Service
    ENTITY_LINK Group
    ENTITY_LINK Person
    ENUM Priority - SawPriority

  2. Create full, new, and preview forms with the three fields above.

  3. Create processes and rules for the record.
  4. Select Enable to enable the SLT settings for the records. 
  5. Configure the following fields:
    Field Description
    Service Field Defines a Service field in the custom record type. The Service field is required as the key field of SLT settings.
    Group Field Defines a Group field in the custom record type. 
    Priority Field Defines a Priority field in the custom record type.
    Customer Field Defines a Person field in the custom record type.
  6. Click Save.
  7. Click Apply.

The Targets tab, within the record in the new module, is displayed only when the SLT settings are enabled.
